Column Comment.0: REPORTING HIERARCHY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the reporting reserveshierarchy that has been defined.
Column Comment.1: COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the component associated with thishierarchy level.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AREA IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an area.
Column Comment.4: AREA TYPE: The type of area, such as area of interest, country, county etc.
Column Comment.5: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.6: ORGANIZATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to alloworganizations to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.7: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.8: RESERVE HIERARCHY COMPONENT TYPE: The type of business object that hasbeen associated with a level in the hierarchy. Could be field, lease, area of interest,geographic area etc.
Column Comment.9: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.13: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.14: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventually becomea SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.15: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field.
Column Comment.16: FINANCE SUIMMARY IDENTIFIER: Summary information about a financialreference, such as an AFE for an activity, such as seismic acquisition or processing.Could be a cost center or any other reference number.
Column Comment.17: HIERARCHY TYPE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the reserves hierarchy typethat has been defined.
Column Comment.18: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.19: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND UNIT, LAND UNIT TRACT, LANDAGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.20: LEVELSEQUENCE NUMBER: Unique sequence number identifying the level in thehierarchy that this object occupies. Must be a number.
Column Comment.21: PARENT RESERVE ENTITY COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thecomponent that is the hierarchical parent of this one.
Column Comment.22: POOL IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying the pool.
Column Comment.23: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.24: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.27: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.28: STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphicname set.
Column Comment.29: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.30: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.31: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a well or a row in the WELL table.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
